title: Drawing, Design for Ditlevsen & Cia Automotive Display, ca. 1925
title_raw: Design for Ditlevsen & Cia Automotive Display
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache, pen and gold ink on gray paperboard
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and gold ink, upper left:  DITLEVSEN & CIA.  In graphite, lower right of drawing:  Kilemnik y Cia; lower right corner of board:  158/F [encircled]
description: View of interior: domed semicircular display space approached by steps flanking a central pillar.   Three potted plants are placed in front of  the  3 pilaster/columns resting on the display floor at the top of the stairs.   A 1920's-style car is parked on  the display floor area; behind it, as a background, is the curved wall made of glass and wrought iron (?) panels, separated by pilasters.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Ditlevsen & Cia Automotive Display, ca. 1925. Graphite, brush and white gouache, pen and gold ink on gray paperboard. 
Gift of Maureen Cogan. 1999-39-21
